fields.value: Secured Registration/Transaction using Fingerprint Recognition for an Automatic Teller Machine (ATM)

dsDescriptionValue.value: A method for operating a computerized system for processing card less transactions using Automatic Teller Machine (ATM), the method comprising the steps of: registering a user’s fingerprint with an entity, by using the user’s fingerprint to create a first image of the user’s fingerprint and then storing the first image of the user’s fingerprint in a digital database of the entity; associating the first image of the user’s fingerprint, now registered, with at least one debit or credit account of the user; receiving, through a transaction device, wherein request comprises a second image of the user’s fingerprint taken by the transaction device at the time the request to authorize the transaction is made; and, authenticating the request to authorize the transaction, by comparing in real time, through a computer network, the second image with the first image of the user’s fingerprint.

keywordValue.value: Account number, Business practice, Credit card, Data processing, Debit card, Fingerprint recognition, Management, Palm recognition

publicationCitation.value: Mitra M (2015) Secured Registration/Transaction using Fingerprint Recognition for an Automatic Teller Machine (ATM). J Comput Eng Inf Technol 4:3. doi:10.4172/2324-9307.1000136

fields.value: At this time full article is not available to download. Abstract can be viewed at https://www.scitechnol.com/peer-review/secured-registration-transaction-using-fingerprint-recognition-for-an-automatic-teller-machine-atm-XK0I.php?article_id=3924
